---
title: IDE Support
---

## Overview

Open Game Backend requires your IDE to support TypeScript & Deno. All major IDEs support this.

## Visual Studio Code

[Install Deno Plugin](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=denoland.vscode-deno)

[More info](https://docs.deno.com/runtime/manual/getting_started/setup_your_environment#visual-studio-code)

## JetBrains

[Install Deno Plugin](https://plugins.jetbrains.com/plugin/14382-deno)

[More info](https://docs.deno.com/runtime/manual/getting_started/setup_your_environment#jetbrains-ides)

## Neovim (`nvim-lsp-config`)

[More info](https://docs.deno.com/runtime/manual/getting_started/setup_your_environment#neovim-06-using-the-built-in-language-server)

## Sublime Text

[LSP plugin](https://lsp.sublimetext.io/language_servers/#deno)

[TypeScript plugin](https://packagecontrol.io/packages/TypeScript)

[More info](https://docs.deno.com/runtime/manual/getting_started/setup_your_environment#sublime-text)

## More options

See the full list of IDEs that support Deno [here](https://docs.deno.com/runtime/manual/getting_started/setup_your_environment).
